subject: Sales
title: Ending With a Clear Ask
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Ending With a Clear Ask.

hook.text: A brilliant pitch ends. Silence. Someone asks: 'So what do you want from us?' Total disaster.

buildup.text: Every pitch needs a clear ask at the end. Without one, even inspired audiences don't know what to do.

discovery.text: The ask should be specific and actionable: a meeting date, an investment amount, or a signed contract.

twist.text: Vague endings like 'Let's stay in touch' waste every minute of momentum the pitch carefully built.

climax.text: State your ask in one confident sentence. Remove all ambiguity. Make the next step obvious.

punchline.text: A great pitch without a clear ask is just a speech.

quiz.question: Why do pitches fail without a clear ask?
options: Even inspired audiences don't know what action to take
